fields.summary: Fix incompatibility in client response between 3.6 and 3.7

items.toString: I noticed that 3.7.5 code does not includ “kv_data” in the consensus snapshot if the negotiated version is < 22. That’s a problem because 3.6 does expect “kv_data” and not including it will cause data consistency problems.

fields.summary: Fix a bug where "kv_data" is not included in the snapshot created by 3.7 for 3.6

[https://github.com/EnterpriseDB/pglogical/blob/fc7602d630ac85c8365344ec24323e30f7bd31ef/pglogical_executor.c#L709|https://github.com/EnterpriseDB/pglogical/blob/fc7602d630ac85c8365344ec24323e30f7bd31ef/pglogical_executor.c#L709]

Over here : [https://ci.2ndquadrant.com/jenkins/view/bdr-36-se/job/pglogical3_6/job/rpm-pipeline/8873/console|https://ci.2ndquadrant.com/jenkins/view/bdr-36-se/job/pglogical3_6/job/rpm-pipeline/8873/console]
Error looks like:

{noformat}pglogical_executor.c: In function 'pglogical_ProcessUtility':
pglogical_executor.c:709:8: error: 'T_CallStmt' undeclared (first use in this function)
   case T_CallStmt:
        ^
pglogical_executor.c:709:8: note: each undeclared identifier is reported only once for each function it appears in
make: *** [pglogical_executor.o] Error 1
error: Bad exit status from /var/tmp/rpm-tmp.bmWWNa (%build)
{noformat}

items.fromString: wal decoder is not enabled on new joined node
items.toString: wal decoder is not enabled on newly joined node

items.fromString:
Test 002_wal_decoder_basic.pl  that exists in branch dev/rm18868 fails with following behavior.

bdr node group is created on Node0 and wal decoder is enabled. Now node1 and node2 joins this group.

expected: wal decoder should be enabled node1 and node2
Actual: the decoder slot is not created on these nodes and the wal decoder is disabled.
items.toString:
Test 002_wal_decoder_basic.pl  that exists in branch dev/rm18868 fails with following behavior.

bdr node group is created on Node0 and wal decoder is enabled. Now node1 and node2 joins this group.

expected: wal decoder should be enabled node1 and node2
Actual: the decoder slot is not created on these nodes and the wal decoder is disabled.

Found when testing BDR-52.

Test 002_wal_decoder_basic.pl  that exists in branch dev/rm18868 fails with following behavior.

bdr node group is created on Node0 and wal decoder is enabled. Now node1 and node2 joins this group.

expected: wal decoder should be enabled node1 and node2
Actual: the decoder slot is not created on these nodes and the wal decoder is disabled.

items.fromString: Software Simplified Workflow for Project BDR

items.toString: When CAMO commits on apply it _must_ use async commit to ensure that Writer process does not block waiting for WAL to go to disk. This then reqires that CAMO completion messages are not sent until after WAL has been written to disk. Presumably this reqires the Writer to remember the LSN of the apply commit in shmem, which will then be checked before the Reader process replies to the origin.

fields.summary: Async commit for CAMO

items.toString:
We currently set what can be replicated both in BDR and PGL, but if something is not mentioned in PGL, BDR can’t really do anything about it since it’s not even called.

We should likely change the {{preprocess_ddl_cb}} to return boolean and if it’s true, the check for statement type in pglogical should not even be called.

fields.summary: PGL DDL replication preprocess call should override internal logic
